text:
Hi Community,
Quick Question:
What middleware providers do you mostly use when connecting HubSpot to a third?(I understand it may depend on the problem you are trying to solve but just trying to learn about market leaders) My user case is I need some middleware to explore connecting a webhook subscription to middleware before sending it to the destination.
I've seen people use things like Scribe and Zapier
if you have more requirements than what zapier give, some of our clients use azuqua
I've used Zapier, or I'll create my own on DigitalOcean using Express
Is it just me, or is this new?
I swear this just appeared in the last 10 minutes.  I was training a coworker who is new to using HubSpot and saw it during a screenshare
I just about fell out my chair while creating a module
Is it only on repeaters, or is it on all custom modules?
someone deserves a hug
I think it's just repeaters
Whoa! :dance:
Hi all. Just on repeaters. It was a request that came in and was a quick thing to add, so we added it. Let us know if you see any issues using it!
When you say 'on all custom modules' can you elaborate a bit on what you mean? Is this something that you're interested in?
This is a great addition.  Thanks very much.  I have some repeaters that are highly customizable, it will be great to only have to do the setup once

Absolutely! I think I posted about it the ideas thread a while back... but it's probably not being shown in the 10k allowed messages. So basically, a custom module has the potential to be used multiple times on a page with various settings that could be repeated several times on specifically that page. It would be great if we could clone that instance of the custom module for specifically that page within a flexible column and it kept the localized overrides specific to the copied item.

This is a different scenario to the repeater option in that there could be various other modules between the two items, but it would mean not necessarily having to override the defaults again, for that particular page
Gotcha. And when you say 'kept the localized overrides specific to the copied item' let me make sure I understand.
1. I place module A on my page.
2. I make changes to the values for that module.
3. The new module instance, copy B, should have the same values as A.
(As opposed to the default values of A)
Is that right?
yep!

Got it! So, we've been doing a ton of work in the editors over the last two years now, and are starting to get closer to a wider release. I can say, for sure, that we want to allow this kind of cloning. So keep an eye out. :slightly_smiling_face:
cc: <@U8THBCFC4>

I was doing some content pour a while back with a new buildout where we created (perhaps overzealously) extremely customizable modules. Which was amazing in reducing the number of modules needed for managment.... but got very tedious in resetting to the same instance that I had already created for that page
Brilliant!!! Just in time to record the how-to gifs for our new template tutorials :nerd_face:
